results.title: Freedom
results.creator_credit: Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: During his trip back to Normandy on the 65th anniversary of D-day, Bob Gatherum reflects on the lasting legacy of war. Travelling through Normandy, he was surprised and amazed at the appreciation shown by the local people whose freedom he and his fellow soldiers had helped protect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: For all who served
results.creator_credit: Jack Holdsworth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jack Holdsworth is one of the few remaining ‘Rats of Tobruk’. Here he reflects fondly on his time during the war and how the extreme circumstances created a strong bond between soldiers and their commanding officers. This bond, as Jack puts it, is a ‘hard habit to break’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Holdsworth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Jack Holdsworth is one of the few remaining ‘Rats of Tobruk’. Here he reflects fondly on his time during the war and how the extreme circumstances created a strong bond between soldiers and their commanding officers. This bond, as Jack puts it, is a ‘hard habit to break’.

results.title: The Correspondence
results.creator_credit: Gordon White, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gordon White, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.

With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.

results.title: Triptych
results.creator_credit: Walter Bird, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Walter Bird recalls a time when he was asked “Where are you from?”, and answered by describing where his house was situated in the neighbourhood. Growing up, he started to learn the implications of that question. He realised that he was ethnically different from other Australian-born children. Being the child of immigrants, Walter weighs up the positives and negatives of being a first generation Australian and shares his experiences when he finally travelled to his parents’ countries.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walter Bird, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Walter Bird recalls a time when he was asked “Where are you from?”, and answered by describing where his house was situated in the neighbourhood. results.title: Prayer for fame
results.creator_credit: Angela Josifoska, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Angela Josifoska, a teenager living in Melbourne’s western suburbs, tells of her quest for fame. She shares her early youth and the things that interested her throughout her life, culminating in a passion for performance. She candidly shares her dreams and ambitions for the future and her determination to succeed shines through.

results.title: Old life, new life
results.creator_credit: Raelanah Loloa, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: For Raelanah Loloa, moving from the town where she grew up in New Zealand to start a new life in Australia was an experience both exciting and stressful. It was hard leaving all her friends and trying to make new ones but, eventually, Raelanah and her family were able to build a new life in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Raelanah Loloa, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

It was hard leaving all her friends and trying to make new ones but, eventually, Raelanah and her family were able to build a new life in Australia.

results.title: Never give up
results.creator_credit: Haris Fazlic, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Haris Fazlic got sick of being larger than his classmates and took up exercising and, eventually, discovered his passion for wrestling. This passion has driven him to win many times despite having to overcome a major obstacle on the way. Wrestling has taught Haris that you should never give up on something you love, no matter what.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Haris Fazlic, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My special family
results.creator_credit: Erin Wilson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Erin Wilson pays tribute to her special family, a family who have taught her all about life. From her family, Erin has learnt responsibility, empathy, the realities of life and death and, most importantly, love and friendship. Here she pays tribute to the members of this special family.
